attributes.action: All 650 MPs must be present in debate if a petition gets 1,000,000+ signatures.
attributes.additional_details: There are 650 MPs and around 65,000,000 people in the UK. This means that each MP is responsible on average for around 100,000 people. If a petition gets 1,000,000 or more signatures, it is in evidence that at least 10 MPs have failed to carry out their duties correctly.
attributes.background: Make it obligatory that all 650 MPs are present in debate of a petition that has achieved 1,000,000 or more signatures.

rejection.details: We understand that you want the Government or House of Commons to change how petitions that receive a certain number of signatures are treated, but it is up to individual MPs, not the Government or House of Commons, to decide which debates to attend.
